definition: Robert Mugabe (1924-), Zimbabwean ZANU-PF politician, president of Zimbabwe 1987-2017
solemn/reverent/calm/burial position in an ancestral tomb (old)/old variant of 默
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.chinese: 顯然穆加貝對此付之一笑。

sentences.english: Outside Leo Mugabe, President of Zimbabwe's association buttonholed me.
sentences.chinese: 津巴布韋足協主席萊奧穆加貝在外面攔住我。

sentences.english: So does Mugabe, even at 85, have the capacity to change?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，已經85歲高齡的穆加貝還有能力改變嗎？

sentences.english: Mugabe knows he cannot go it alone.
sentences.chinese: 穆加貝明白他不能一意孤行。

sentences.english: The only person who profits from these divisions is Mr Mugabe himself.
sentences.chinese: 只有一個人從這些分歧中受益，那就是穆加貝先生。

sentences.english: Sixty-one percent of Zimbabweans have only known Robert Mugabe's rule.
sentences.chinese: 61%的津巴布韋人只知道羅伯特穆加貝。

sentences.english: Others are still susceptible to the appeal of Mr Mugabe's anti-colonialist rhetoric.
sentences.chinese: 其他人仍然受到穆加貝先生反殖民主義言論的影響。

sentences.english: Mr Mugabe says that indigenisation “recognises our sovereign right of ownership”.
sentences.chinese: 穆加貝先生稱本地化是“承認我們擁有的主權權利”。

sentences.english: Yet his regime is more susceptible to pressure than it seems.
sentences.chinese: 不過，穆加貝的政權更易受到外界壓力的影響。

sentences.english: Yet Mugabe apparently tries to laugh off his global infamy.
sentences.chinese: 然而穆加貝顯然對他在國際社會上的臭名一笑置之。

sentences.english: In recent years, Mugabe has grown even more ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的幾年中，穆加貝的殘暴愈加變本加厲。

sentences.english: President Robert Mugabe launched his re-election campaign on Sunday accusing Tsvangirai of extensive political violence.
sentences.chinese: 津巴布韋總統穆加貝星期天開始了自己的連任競選。
